story.iWant: to clearly see the AI-generated workout plan, including any adaptations based on my context, and have options to confirm or edit it
story.soThat: I can maintain control over my training and ensure it aligns with my preferences before starting
story.tasks: - [ ] **Task 1: Implement Plan Display UI (AC2.3.1, AC2.3.2)** - [ ] Subtask 1.1: Create a React component for displaying the AI-generated workout plan (`apps/web/src/components/PlanReview.tsx`). - [ ] Subtask 1.2: Design and implement the layout for exercise items including name, RPE, sets/reps, and an optional image/thumbnail per Flow 6, Screen 3. - [ ] Subtask 1.3: Implement the "AI Context Card" to display `ai_explanation` received from the backend, highlighting adaptations. - [ ] Subtask 1.4: Integrate the `PlanReview` component into the Dashboard or a dedicated plan review page. - [ ] **Task 2: Implement Plan Confirmation (AC2.3.3, AC2.3.4)** - [ ] Subtask 2.1: Implement the `[ Confirm Plan ]` button on the `PlanReview` UI. - [ ] Subtask 2.2: Create a function in `apps/web/src/lib/api.ts` to call the `POST /plans/{planId}/confirm` endpoint. - [ ] Subtask 2.3: Integrate the confirmation API call with the `[ Confirm Plan ]` button. - [ ] Subtask 2.4: Handle loading states and potential API errors for confirmation. - [ ] **Task 3: Implement Plan Editing (AC2.3.3)** - [ ] Subtask 3.1: Implement the `[ Edit Plan ]` button on the `PlanReview` UI. - [ ] Subtask 3.2: Define the basic navigation or modal structure for a future plan editing interface (initial implementation can be a placeholder).

acceptanceCriteria.criterion: The AI-generated plan is displayed to the user in a clear, readable format, visually aligned with Flow 6, Screen 3 of the UX design, including exercise details and an optional image/thumbnail.
Any AI adaptations are visually highlighted with the corresponding explanation ("AI Context Card"), aligned with Flow 6, Screen 3 of the UX design.
The user has prominently displayed options to `[ Confirm Plan ]` or `[ Edit Plan ]`, visually aligned with Flow 6, Screen 3 of the UX design.
Tapping `[ Confirm Plan ]` triggers a call to `POST /plans/{planId}/confirm` to mark the plan as confirmed in the backend.

constraints.constraint: UI must adhere to Flow 6, Screen 3 visual specifications.
Data submission for confirmation must be authenticated with a valid JWT.
Frontend must handle loading and error states for plan confirmation gracefully.
The plan editing interface can be a placeholder for now, with full implementation in a future story.

Integration tests to ensure the "Confirm Plan" button correctly dispatches the API call. Test files co-located where appropriate (e.g., `apps/web/tests/components/` or `apps/web/tests/lib/`).
